fields.description:
I created pull request and page keeps reloading (both for me and my teammates).\\
The problem exists only for one particular branch, other PRs that I create are ok.\\
I tried recreating PR, deleting the branch at bitbucket, renaming it, nothing helped.\\
Me and my colleagues use latest Google Chrome Version 71.0.3578.98, this pull request displays normally from elder versions(tested on 70.0.3538.110), incognito mode and Safari.

I Can create new repositories but due to some server problem from bitbucket two of my repositories are stuck on creating..How can i delete those.

i previously created an issue but no one responded..Please help me delete those.
fields.summary: STUCK ON CREATING REPOSITORY !!!

fields.description:
In Settings >> User and group access

When entering a username, it would be really convenient to see (suggest) users I have added recently or are in my other repos. Then I wouldn't have to look up their username or email each time.
fields.summary: Suggest recent users

fields.description:
h3. Description
Page load times show a measurable increase using Chrome Dev Tools when changing the language setting in my Bitbucket profile from English to Spanish. Another Atlassian has tested Russian as well, with the same results.

*Español*

La velocidad de carga de Bitbucket es más lenta cuando el idioma está configurado en español.

h3. Expected Result
With caching and a CDN, assets related to a Spanish product experience should load equally fast to English. This should take into account the initial load and subsequent local asset caching.

h3. Actual Result
Assets unrelated to {{es.js}} (for content translation) show a slower load time, including an increase in TTFB.
fields.summary: Slower page load times when serving pages under non-English settings (e.g. Spanish, Russian, etc)

fields.description:
Adding a list of recently used branches/tags (populate using branches or tags recently searched for etc, or even calculate from recent commits by logged in user).

!3262673190-Screen%20Shot%202018-12-17%20at%202.29.28%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add "Recent" tab to commit/tag search pop-up

fields.description:
As per this documentation, it's possible to use the size:2x flag on Pipelines to allocate 8GB of memory to your build:\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/configure-bitbucket-pipelines-yml-792298910.html#Configurebitbucket-pipelines.yml-ci_sizesize

Unfortunately, it's only possible to use size:1x and size:2x at the moment.

It would be great to be able to allocate as much memory as needed (with a limit of course) by using flags such as:\\
size:0.5x\\
size:0.25x\\
size:3x\\
size:4x

This will allow more robust builds to run much faster and avoid memory management issues with services, and will also allow smaller builds that don't require a lot of memory to spend less build minutes
fields.summary: Allow to allocate different sizes of memory on Pipelines

fields.description:
According to the following documentation:\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/bitbucket-deployments-940695276.html

it's only possible to perform deployments to the following environments:\\
test\\
staging\\
production

It would be nice to allow deployments to any other, user-defined environments, with different names.
fields.summary: Allow deployments for environments other than test, staging and prod

fields.description: It would be nice if I could view the entire history of a branch in a diff view, rather than being limited to viewing the diff for a single commit. I would like to see all the changes made since a branch was created.
fields.summary: Request for branch history diff view

fields.description: If I have a private commercial Jira instance, and private commercial BitBucket instance and they are linked, no information should be able to escape those bounds;
fields.summary: The Create Branch dialog shows all repositories a user has interacted with. It shouldn't.

fields.description:
As the title says, it would be great to manage branch permissions and merge checks for a specific team account, instead of setting this for each repository.\\
It would make sense as you would be able to set a specific branch pattern for each permission, for example, for bugs you could name all your branches on all repositories "bug-<text>" and set up a branch permission to track "bug-*", which would apply to all repositories under the team account and all branches named "bug-<text>"
fields.summary: Allow branch permissions and merge checks for all team repositories

fields.description: Code view window is too small. Any touch to it cause keyboard pop-up.
fields.summary: Mobile website is absolutely unusable

fields.description:
Since as a customer, we are paying per 1000 compute minutes, it makes sense for those of us with very large test suites that want to parallelize them beyond 10 instances. Our specific use case is running browser-based integration tests across multiple versions of supported browsers, and the more we can parallelize, the merrier. Right now we're hard capped at 10 concurrent runs, which isn't enough for us to run all our tests in parallel.

Ideally we can run upwards of 50 concurrent instances, but ultimately I feel the limit should be higher than 10 with a reasonable cap.

The cap for a competing product, CircleCI, is 64 concurrent instances. I see no reason why Pipelines can't support at least 30+ concurrent steps.
fields.summary: Increase Pipeline step limit beyond 10

fields.description:
!2408458262-Screenshot_20181215-155832.png|thumbnail!

Android, Chrome.
fields.summary: Mobile website, settings

fields.description: So I thought when I attached my card for overage minutes, that if I bought 1000 minutes I would have 1000 till I ran out, turns out this is not accurate. I would like an extra minutes plan where the minutes roll over (I didn't think we had to talk about roll over minutes anymore :/ ). See I'm the sole developer on a lot of my code, so I don't need to give someone else access, and usually if I go over 50 minutes it's only maybe up to 70 minutes, and some months I won't do anything at all. I think 1000 minutes for $10 is a good deal, but not if it's use 'em or lose em, 'cause then it's $120 a year for only a few minutes over. I've removed my payment details for now, because of this. I would be happy to pay $10 for 1000 minutes that roll over though.
fields.summary: Fair pipelines pricing for sole developers

fields.description:
Relates to Issue BCLOUD-11571

Just noticed a strange bug in the new default description for pull requests.

Line feeds are not rendering properly.

Try putting the following in as default description...

{code}
## Quality
[ ] Code builds clean without errors or warnings
[ ] I have followed our style guide
{code}

When it renders later, the line feed doesn't show up between the second line ending with the word 'warnings' and the next line beginning with '[ ] I have'. The two lines just print out as one.

Like this

h2. Quality
[ ] Code builds clean without errors or warnings [ ] I have followed our style guide

----
See attached screenshots for examples...

My OS = Windows 10, 64bit\\
My Browser = Version 71.0.3578.98 (Official Build) (64-bit)
fields.summary: Line feeds not rendering in default description field

fields.description:
As per the title, there is no mention on the documentation that this isn't possible and it would be useful for the bitbucket Pipelines yml validator to point that parallel steps cannot have deployment steps.

Today, the behavior looks like this:

Yml file, validator did not point that this is an impossible config:\\
!2838556078-Screen%20Shot%202018-12-14%20at%2017.39.24.png|thumbnail!

Pipelines showing that this is an issue and cannot proceed with the build:\\
!4155933676-Screen%20Shot%202018-12-14%20at%2017.36.56.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Pipelines validator does not point out that parallel steps can't contain deployments.

fields.description:
People have been importing another public repo, which is awesome, EXCEPT that it @ mentions me:

https://bitbucket.org/NewWaveWeb/wordpress/commits/110a98f5e731211a1823c64897930594cf43832a

The only way to prevent those notifications is to disable notifications for ALL @-messages, which seems a little counter productive.

It seems like a no-brainer that I should be able to say "No alerts from this repo/person/company" at the very least from a privacy/harassment standpoint.

A probably better and more over-reaching check should be if people are importing repositories, default to NOT send notifications.
fields.summary: Can't block notifications from individual repositories

fields.description:
Users who have 2 or more accounts (e.g, work and personal) who browse to http://bitbucket.org with an old session still in effect, are presented with a 2FA page that doesn't say _which_ account they're authenticating.

Please show the username on that page, to save users mistakenly locking out the account they didn't think they were using, or just to avoid that frustration.
fields.summary: 2FA landing page should show which account is being authenticated

fields.description:
*Issue*\\
I am trying to create a link to my issue tracker based on the commit message.\\
Custom Repository links do not seem to work as numbers are automatically hijacked by bitbucket, pointing to non-existent commits.

*Reproduction steps*

* Navigate to {{repository settings}} > {{links}}
* Click {{add link}} and then choose a custom link with the following properties:\\
Link key: SC-\d+\\
Link url: https://my.isssue.tracker.com/\1

I am trying to target commit message like the following:\\
{{[SC-12345] My commit message}}
fields.summary: Custom Links are broken - hijacked by bitbucket commits

fields.description:
Currently, there are some users who are using Bitbucket cloud issue tracker with HiDPI images for collaboration.

It would be best if we can have the ability to "Scale" and/or "Resize" HiDPI or any types of images when uploading from Issue tracker.
fields.summary: Issue Tracker: Ability to scale or resize inline image

when i open website in chrome, from this url

* Go to repo main page

Expected:

Actual:

fields.description:
We set up a rule where a pull request needs two approval to be able to merge. When two members, A and B, approve a pull requests, on the console it showed only 1 member has approved:

* If member A logs in, bitbucket shows that there is 1 approval from member A
* If member B or other login, bitbucket shows that there is 1 approval from member B

fields.description: What happened to all the forking options? They're only accessible using the '+' icon, which contextually is confusing. It would be nice to have a fork icon on the sidebar.

I tried [this fix|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/My-Bitbucket-repository-doesn-t-show-the-quot-Overview-quot-page/qaq-p/724511] and it did not change anything. Unless I have visited the repos before and therefore have the url in my browser history, it takes me a little extra to get to the repo that I need to. Add to that, I am no longer able to see the pull requests that I am tagged in to review.

fields.description:
Hi, the swagger definition at https://bitbucket.org/api/swagger.json?_ga=2.266811975.819807041.1544523433-438775995.1506441662 produces errors.

The specific error I'm seeing is:

"Required property 'responses' not found in JSON. Path 'paths['/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/properties/{app_key}/{property_name}'].put', line 8379, position 15."

(The line number refers to  a beautified version of the original)

I have tried to generate a client from the Swagger file using NSwaggerStudio and the web based tool at http://editor.swagger.io. Both tools error, although I'm not shown a specific error message with the latter.

My company is migrating to Bitbucket, but we can't easily migrate our repositories without access to the API.

Please can you provide a fixed API definition?

I'm a little surprised that I've had to report this through three separate Atlassiann channels :(
fields.summary: Bitbucket API Swagger definition throws error

fields.description:
As per the title, on the Bitbucket and Slack integration(https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1218781/bitbucket-cloud-for-slack-official?hosting=cloud&tab=overview) there is currently no way to stop sending notifications to the watched channel when an action from a specific user is done.

Today the chat notification settings look like this:\\
!489770672-Screen%20Shot%202018-12-12%20at%2015.22.51.png|thumbnail!

However, it would be good to have a field to exclude notifications from a specific user.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Cloud for Slack (Official) integration does not include an option to exclude notifications from a specific user

fields.description:
Hi,

I noticed BitBucket changed their webhook IP addresses and CIDR ranges. Do we have a list of webhook only ip addresses I can whitelist?

Changes to the [manage webhooks|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/manage-webhooks-735643732.html] article was made on the 4th Dec but it appears to have removed the webhook IP and CIDR ranges.

Whitelisting the full (currently 54) IP and CIDR ranges is not a viable option and my security team have raised concerns on whitlisting so many IP addresses for a single service.

At the moment all of our CI and CD pipelines in our CI tool are broken due this bug.

Your help is appreciated.

Many Thanks\\
Abdul
fields.summary: Webhook IP addresses changed - no update provided

fields.description:
When we access commits or branches from Jira to Bitbucket,  we are not automatically logged in even though we are using SSO/SAML (Atlassian Access).

It would be good to be auto logged in Bitbucket or at least be prompted to log in, since our team account is set to private and, we get the "You were never here" message that leads us to believe that either the redirect failed or our account was deleted/modified and we do not have access to it.
fields.summary: When redirected from Jira/Confluence auto SSO/SAML Bitbucket
Alter documentation or API endpoint for api.bitbucket.org/2.0/users/<user>/ssh-keys

I had created a pipeline which is not initiating as, we are connecting ftp with the repository and before setting it to push we have to init it and while init it is taking more than 120 minutes to upload the codes

So can you please tell me how to fix it.
fields.summary: Getting this issue Exceeded build time limit of 120 minutes.

fields.description:
Hi

Right now you can add SSH keys in 3 ways:

# as an ssh key under your account, you get relevant read/write access depending on the group/user access permissions defined for repo's and projects
# as an ssh key under an organisation/team - this gets read/write access to all repo's under the team/org
# as an access-key under a specific repo - this grants ONLY read access to that repo

It would be great for the following possible additional options

4 . create an ssh key under an org/team but with read only permissions

5 . create an ssh key under a repo that also has write access to the repo

option 4 might be useful for external build systems that may need access to multiple BB repos

Option 5 might be useful for remote systems that automatically push back changes (e.g. rancid or similar automated tools/scripts)
fields.summary: Allow Read/Write access keys for a single repo and/or project

fields.description:
As the title says, it would be great to have the following information be available on the /2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/commit/{node} endpoint (https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commit/%7Bnode%7D):

* File changes - Additions/Removals
* Name of the refs/tags that the commit is part of
fields.summary: Include even more relevant information on the /2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/commit/{node} endpoint

fields.description:
For environments where Jira timesheets must be filled in, when filling in things like Pull Request approvals for coworkers' code changes, it would be very helpful to have the ability to quickly search Bitbucket for things like My Activity to report what Pull Requests a user has made to other developers' branches.

The ability to search for things like that, or other similar Bitbucket tags, would speed up and correctly match what developers will fill in of Jira timesheets. I'm sure Atlassian would benefit from showing customers a major ability to manage timesheets across team members' efforts like this, as right now, the only easy types of things to fill in are searching for your own development hours on your own branches.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Search by My Activity, and similer tags - will help streamline Jira Timesheet data to Bitbucket

fields.description: As per the title, the request here is to add the ability to get redirected to Jira when clicking on a branch which has its name originating from a Jira ticket, when the Jira integration is correctly set up.
fields.summary: Ability to link to a Jira ticket through the branch name when the branch name has a ticket number

fields.description:
In API 1.0, you can get all file name directory using the API below.

https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/username/repo_name/directory

*Result*:

{code}
#!python
{
    "revision": "e5l21184e9027060a4121117q21a26289ad6b086",
    "start": 0,
    "values": ["/", "some-file.txt", "some-file2.txt", "some-file3.txt"],
    "limit": 10000,
    "isLastPage": true,
    "size": 50
}
{code}

In API 2.0 there's no API endpoint that has the same result as this.

It would be best if we can have the same endpoint like the API 1.0 directory

1.0/repositories/username/repo_name/directory => 2.0/repositories/username/repo_name/directory
fields.summary: Allow Directory API in API 2.0
Please add Flutter as the Language selection

fields.description:
When I navigate between different repository pipelines, the pipeline for the previously selected pipeline is shown.

To reproduce:

# Navigate to a repository listed under "Your work" and select "Pipelines".
# Navigate back to "Your work" and select a different repository. Select "Pipelines".
# Observe that the pipeline data displayed is actually for the repository selected in step 1 and not step 2.

Browser: Google Chrome Version 70.0.3538.110 (Official Build) (64-bit)
fields.summary: Pipeline shows data for another repository
Cannot promote deployment.

fields.description:
I have set the sprint start and end date. This changes to jira installation date as start date and current date as end date on day to day basis.

Currently I am resetting on day to day basis to show the right info on the board. Else board will have 0 days on sprint.

I am not sure any specific parameter need to be setup.
fields.summary: start and end date of sprint changes everyday

fields.description:
Currently when a pull-request is accepted by copying the commits, the only way to close it is to reject it. This is technically correct (since the exact commits do not enter the repository, though the actual patch does), but it does not feel good to the contributor.

Here is an example:

https://bitbucket.org/durin42/hg-git/pull-requests/63/support-hg-47-demandimportignores-api-with/diff

I knew that rejecting the pull-request is the only option, but seeing that "rejected" still felt bad (and feels bad).

Therefore I would like to have an option to close a pull-request without rejecting it. I do not want contributors to feel bad, just because I grafted or rebased a commit instead of merging the pull-request. Instead I would like the state in the pull-request to say something along the lines of "approved, closed".
fields.summary: Allow closing a pull-request without rejecting it

fields.description:
I like the idea of tracking deployment history in bitbucket, especially the JIRA integrations.

for one reason or another i am unable to make use of pipelines at this time but i would like to be able to track deployments via the bitbucket web interface

i was expecting some kind of API call - perhaps a post to : /2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/deployments/

https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/deployments/

with the required parameters could then create a deployment that has the relevant information of a normal deployment triggered and tracked as part of a normal pipelines task flow.

one could trigger the post as part of some external deployment process (for example at the end of a capistrano run or php deployer run or after a successful jenkins build etc)
fields.summary: Allow Creation of "Deployment" without using pipelines - via API or similar

fields.description:
During the creation of a pull request on Bitbucket, the tool does not state that there is a merge conflict between the branches of the pull request, but it does warn about merge conflicts *after* the creation of such pull request.

Would it be possible to add a merge conflict warning during the creation of the pull request as well?
fields.summary: Warn about merge conflicts before pull request creation

fields.description: As the title says, it would be good to be able to remove builds from Pipelines' history, as it's possible that the build shows up data that is unwanted, accidentally.
fields.summary: Allow users to remove builds from their Pipelines history

fields.description:
Hello

Today our projects started to failure with the following error:\\
Retrying 'FindPackagesByIdAsync' for source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/system.diagnostics.tracesource/index.json'.\\
The HTTP request to 'GET https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/system.diagnostics.tracesource/index.json' has timed out after 100000ms.

When trying to connect to https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/system.diagnostics.tracesource/index.json from our local boxes it works fine.

Please investigate\\
Thanks
fields.summary: Cannot connect to api.nuget.org from pipeline

fields.description:
Bitbucket Cloud only provides two option: "Repositories this group can currently access" and "All repositories that _Team_ owns".

It will best that Bitbucket Cloud includes the option to allow users to select specific repositories for a specific user group instead of the admin update each repository individually.
fields.summary: Ability to grant user group with a subset of repositories

fields.description:
From BCLOUD-11571:

bq. Prior to activating the templates, I could use a commit message like the following:


{code}
Derezz the master control program

MCP turned out to be evil and had become intent on world domination.
This commit throws Tron's disc into MCP (causing its deresolution)
and turns it back into a chess game.
{code}

bq. And it would use the first line (subject line) as the PR title and the message would automatically be inserted into the description. If I've already written a detailed commit message, I don't want to have to re-type it for the PR.
fields.summary: Support commit list substitution in pull request description templates

fields.description:
When attempting to create a scheduled Pipeline for a branch with the "/" character in its name, the UI shows no Step options, see the image below:\\
!3142929388-Screen%20Shot%202018-12-07%20at%2017.18.26.png|thumbnail!

Switching to a different branch without this character on its name shows the correct steps which are supposed to be on that branch's yml file:\\
!2487162529-Screen%20Shot%202018-12-07%20at%2017.18.34.png|thumbnail!

However switching back to the branch with "/" on its name will show the same steps which can be seen on the previously selected branch:\\
!924677959-Screen%20Shot%202018-12-07%20at%2017.18.42.png|thumbnail!

Just for reference, this is my yml file for the "dev/test123" branch:\\
!2690389692-Screen%20Shot%202018-12-07%20at%2017.28.26.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Creating a scheduled Pipelines for a branch with the "/" character in the name fails

fields.description:
It opens Source code, even if setting is Commits

Interestingly, if you open it from the list of all repos, or team's repos, it works correctly, but not when you go from the overview, even while urls are the same?

And I really think it worked before, even though I'm not 100% sure
fields.summary: When going to REPO from the dashboard/overview, the "Landing page" setting is not respected

fields.description: Some calls to /2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/diffstat/{spec} return 404. The documentation at https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/diffstat/%7Bspec%7D does not document this behaviour. When can that endpoint return 404? What does it mean?
fields.summary: Undocumented 404 to /2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/diffstat/{spec}

fields.description:
It would be very convenient to have a Run Pipeline button with custom pipeline select box on the main page of the repository.

This would run the pipeline on the HEAD of the main branch.

Our use case is we want to run a "release" pipeline on our libraries (we use maven and npm and want to release those libraries to be used in other projects).

This would also be useful for "cellophane wrapped" software that is not on an automatic CD system, and requires someone to decide to "release" the project manually.

Having this button on the main page means you don't have to navigate to specific commits (2-3 clicks and page loads) to find the button to push.  We have some non-software developers that need to hit this button sometimes, and the button is too deep in the details.

Related: Add the same button to the Branch page. (Currently available on the ... on the branches _list_ page, but not the Branch page itself, which is odd).

Also related or even better: let the pipeline be run from Jira release hub (like bamboo used to do).  Obviously would have to tag the pipeline as the release pipeline, or rely on a specific custom pipeline name like "release" or something.
fields.summary: Add Run Pipeline button to main page of repo

fields.description:
I have an app that fetches pull requests for several teams. For one of them a curious thing happens, the link /2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/pullrequests?pagelen=50 returns a 403, but only for one repo_slug - others, including from the same team, work fine. Here are the relevant headers:

X-Credential-Type:[jwt]\\
X-Accepted-Oauth-Scopes:[pullrequest]\\
X-Oauth-Scopes:[account, pullrequest, team]

The documentation here: https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests#get does not mention a 403.

How do I further debug this or work around this?
fields.summary: Undocumented 403 to /2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/pullrequests

fields.description:
As the title says, it would be great being able to keep track of who deleted branches of the repositories under an account on the audit log.

This considers Branch deletion via UI, branch deletion via API, branch deletion via command line
fields.summary: Add information regarding who deleted a branch on audit logs

fields.description:
https://github.com/moby/buildkit

My use case:

At the moment I run {{docker-compose build}} within BitBucket Pipelines to build .NET Core code. Pipelines has a NuGet cache, but I can't use this because Docker builds run within a container on Docker, and you can't mount volumes into builds with Docker.

I spoke to one of the maintainers for docker-compose and I've been informed that BuildKit allows this via the [cache mounting type|https://github.com/moby/buildkit/blob/master/frontend/dockerfile/docs/experimental.md#run---mounttypecache] which would allow me to use it within my pipelines builds.

Admittedly there is an alternative in the form of moving my build directly into pipelines, but this would prevent me reproducing the exact same build locally, etc.
fields.summary: Enable BuildKit (experimental) on Pipelines

fields.description:
In this issue tracker, when you click the "Image" icon, you're presented with an option to drag an image file into the modal to upload it.

However, sometimes users don't want to save the image to their computer before uploading it. For example, maybe they used the snipping tool or took a screenshot and then cropped it in Paint.

It would be nice if the image upload feature allowed you to paste images directly from your clipboard, a feature that many image hosting websites have.

Relevant StackOverflow thread that contains a link to the clipboard API docs: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6333814/how-does-the-paste-image-from-clipboard-functionality-work-in-gmail-and-google-c
fields.summary: Allow users to copy and paste images into the Upload Image modal

fields.description:
!https://i.imgur.com/VVCfYIj.png!

When I use a web browser (Chrome 70.0 on Windows 10) to commit code, my × symbol gets turned into a � symbol.
fields.summary: × gets changed to � when committing code in the web browser

fields.description:
It would be useful to be able to bookmark a commit in a mercurial repo from the web interface. Equivalent to:

{code}
#!bash

hg bookmark -r <commit-id> <bookmark-name>
{code}

The interface could be similar to the "add a tag" function, except that it should give a list of existing bookmarks to update as well as the option to type in a new bookmark name.

This is a particular issue because:

* Bitbucket pipelines currently do not work on tags in Mercurial, only on bookmarks (see BCLOUD-13819)
* Commits created using the online editor cannot currently be set to activate and advance an existing bookmark (and if you try to activate a bookmark by selecting it from the "branches" list for the commit, you end up creating a branch by that name, see BCLOUD-7361 /  BCLOUD-8154)
* Merges created from the online editor likewise do not update bookmarks on the target (see BCLOUD-12287)

Of course, this would still be a useful enhancement even if those bugs/limitations were fixed!
fields.summary: Create/update Mercurial bookmarks from the online interface

fields.description:
Hello, yesterday we met this issue. We use pipeline for more than a year and usually it works fine.

Last day, I noticed this problem: Don't know why it takes more than 2 hours on the build step. I believe it is not caused by our changes. Can you kindly have a look and would these 2 hours counted by our Build minutes / month usage?

Thanks
fields.summary: Exceeded build time limit of 120 minutes.

fields.description: We have a couple of repositories that are incrementing build / version numbers of our libraries.  This has worked fine since we set it up, but today, the git commands have started failing.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Pipelines failing when committing code / tags back to repository.

fields.description:
I'm aware of the {{[skip ci]}} tag, which is super useful, but there are some cases where a little more control is required. For example, let's say I don't want to trigger a {{branches}} pipeline but I do want to be able to trigger a {{tags}} pipeline, it would be nice if I could just add something like {{[skip branches]}} in the commit message, that way {{branches}} pipelines are not triggered but everything else is.

Practical example:

{code}
#!python

pipelines:
  branches:
    master:
      - step:
          script:
			- echo "Auto version up"
			- echo "Commit and push with [skip branches] in message" # Avoid endless loop

  tags:
    external/**:
      - step:
          script:
			- echo "Create build"
{code}

In the example above I want to automatically version up my application every time a new change is pushed to master and I want to create a build every time a commit in master is tagged as {{external/**}}.
fields.summary: Skip specific types of pipelines based on commit message

fields.description:
Hi,

While reviewing a pull-request, the pull-request overview showed "Files changed (1)" as well as only one file diff, when a different file had been changed in one of the commits tracked by that pull-request. "Files changed" should read (2) and another diff should be shown.

This essentially hides changes from the reviewer from the pull-request overview, and allows for unread code to be merged.

If if helps, the change in the "hidden" file was a single character change.

Cheers,\\
Raphaël
fields.summary: Incorrect "Files changed" shown in pull-request

Would it be possible to enable the IP Whitelisting only for specific repositories and not to every private repository?

* https://bitbucket.org/blog/

Currently, we need to check the Bitbucket blog every so often to see if there is an update.\\
Some kind of push notifications on updates or potential changes/issues would also be very good to be sent in these cases.

In my use-case, we have many people working across multiple branches.\\
Notifications get quite useless when you can't understand where things have been committed.

!991641537-2018-12-05%2009_55_32-Window.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Pipelines often fail without any issue

fields.description:
Currently, Bitbucket Cloud does not have a feature for users to take backups of their repository.\\
The method which users can use now is to perform a clone of their repository as a form of Backup.

_Suggested Solution_

Have a feature like a backup manage where backup of the repositories gets created  and stored for a certain number of day. Users have the ability to download these backups when they would like to. The backups can be cleared or overwritten with new backups every interval of certain number of days.
fields.summary: Feature to create repository backups and available for download

fields.description:
Currently it is possible to transfer repositories to another account one by one. However in cases where there are many repositories, it would take time to transfer them individually.

Therefore, it would be a great feature to have transferring repositories between accounts in a bulk which will save time and minimize effort.
fields.summary: Ability to Bulk Transfer Repositories between accounts.

fields.description:
A problem I am facing and a problem I am seeing others face is the inability for a 'hotfix/' branch to be merged to master and develop branches.  I have seen many an unanswered StackOverflow question about this same issue.

Many companies, including my own, use the _git-flow_ or _GitFlow WorkFlow_ (Atlassian Documentation). This requires that a hotfix is created based on the master branch and be merged back into the master and develop branch.

Atlassian documentation on the matter alludes that this feature exists. See, [Making a Pull Request - Tutorial|https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/making-a-pull-request], specifically the section titled: "Gitflow Workflow With Pull Requests".  It describes exactly, and correctly, how the workflow should work. I can not find this feature anywhere in bitbucket.

If it exists and I can not find the feature - I apologize, please point me in the right direction.

Otherwise, a more succinct version of my request is:

* When a branch is prefixed with either of the following prefixes it should be merged to master and then develop branch.

** hotfix/
** release/
* Should only happen if you have the branching workflow enabled for your repository

Please feel free to reach out to me with any other questions.
fields.summary: Gitflow Workflow unable to merge hotfix/ and/or release/ pull-request to both master and develop

fields.description:
On [October 30th 2018, BitBucket made a blog post|https://bitbucket.org/blog/update-to-outgoing-webhook-ip-addresses] saying that in addition to [the regular IP CIDR whitelist|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/what-are-the-bitbucket-cloud-ip-addresses-i-should-use-to-configure-my-corporate-firewall-343343385.html] that some webhook requests would come from one of their [(currently) 58 public IPs|https://ip-ranges.atlassian.com/].

Consequently, our webhooks began to fail last week (November 30th) as did [many other users|BCLOUD-17668] with NET_ERR or 403s. We resolved this by adding the full list of *58* public IPs, however, this seems unreasonable. If a request commonly originates from something outside the original list, is that list even meaningful?

As IPs can and will change (as they have done in the past and [is documented on their firewall page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/what-are-the-bitbucket-cloud-ip-addresses-i-should-use-to-configure-my-corporate-firewall-343343385.html]). We can check and maintain 3 or so, but 58 IPs? That's painful, unless we write a script maintain firewalls.

Even then it does not seem very secure to have literally dozens of end points we have to white list. Yes we have private/public keys, yes we have passwords, yes we limit ports, but we rather have a small and maintainable IP list (or at the very least one that is not a misleading list).
fields.summary: Maintaining a list of 58 public IPs in a firewall for webhooks seems excessive

fields.description:
We are receiving a 503 on all requests sent to our Build machine.

We have whitelisted the IPs mentioned in this article: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/what-are-the-bitbucket-cloud-ip-addresses-i-should-use-to-configure-my-corporate-firewall-343343385.html

(for hooks like POST)

104.192.136.0/21\\
34.198.203.127\\
34.198.32.85

When we open the machine to allow all traffic it works.  Different IPs appear to being used.
fields.summary: Webhook 503 to Build Machine

fields.description:
Currently, you cannot change the callback URL when generating code using OAuth 2.0.

It would best if we can have a parameter in the API to add a dynamic callback URL.

This is possible in API 1.0: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/users-endpoint-1-0-296092732.html
fields.summary: OAuth 2.0: Add dynamic callback to API

fields.description:
Good day -

It appears that the remote server that responds to a local

{code}
#!shell
$ git update remote
    ```

is NOT providing an up-to-date list of commits.

I am trying to maintain an up-to-date local
copy of a Bit Bucket git:

{code}

#!shell\\
https://bitbucket.org/garageard/nfmihandhygiene_corefw

{code}
This is a paid-for repository for my JCI work.

But the problem is, after I 'git remote update',
recent commits are NOT fetched to my local 
copy - eg. as shown by this script log created
today (2018-12-04):

{code}

#!shell\\
$ cd nfmihandhygiene_corefw/\\
$ git remote update\\
Fetching origin\\
$ echo $?\\
0\\
$ git log --oneline | head -2\\
3e4bca2 ...\\
cf0649d ...

{code}

But this 'git remote update'ed repository is NOT up-to-date!
:

When I then do:

{code}

#!shell\\
$ cd /tmp\\
$ git clone 'https://bitbucket.org/garageard/nfmihandhygiene_corefw'\\
$ cd nfmihandhygiene_corefw\\
$ git log --oneline | head -10 | sed -r 's/[[:space:]].*$//'\\
6f507ae ...\\
800b7f8 ...\\
63706dc ...\\
*3e4bca2* ...\\
*cf0649d* ...\\
...

So the newly cloned copy has gained 3 commits\\
that the 'git remote update'-ed copy cannot see.

Why is this ?

This really makes Bit Bucket's GIT server\\
unusable for us - we need to see new commits\\
getting fetched when a 'git update remote' is done.

Unless this bug is fixed, I'll have to move our\\
GITs onto another platform that works\\
properly (eg. github).

Please fix!
fields.summary: 'git remote update' not updating

The pull request will be shown normally
